required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Pantoprazole 20/40 mg Once Daily (od) in Patients Older Than 12 Years Who Have Gastrointestinal Symptoms of Reflux Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Pantoprazole 20/40 mg in Reflux-Associated Complaints With Focus on Gastrointestinal Symptoms

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to evaluate the effect of 14 days treatment with Pantoprazole 40 mg and 20 mg on gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) related symptoms in a large patient population.

primary_outcome.measure: Reflux-associated Gastrointestinal Symptoms: Assessment of the Severity of Heartburn
primary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

primary_outcome.measure: Reflux-associated Gastrointestinal Symptoms: Assessment of the Severity of Eructation/Sour Eructation
primary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

primary_outcome.measure: Reflux-associated Gastrointestinal Symptoms: Assessment of the Severity of Painful Swallowing
primary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Pantoprazole at Final Visit: Efficacy Regarding Reflux Symptoms
primary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=excellent, 2=good, 3=satisfactory, 4=not satisfactory

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Dyspepsia Symptoms: Assessment of the Severity of Upper Abdominal Pain
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Dyspepsia Symptoms: Assessment of the Severity of Sensation of Fullness
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Dyspepsia Symptoms: Assessment of the Severity of Nausea
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Pantoprazole at Final Visit: Efficacy Regarding Dyspeptic Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=excellent, 2=good, 3=satisfactory, 4=not satisfactory

secondary_outcome.measure: Irritable Bowel Syndrome: Assessment of the Severity of Lower Abdominal Pain
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

secondary_outcome.measure: Irritable Bowel Syndrome: Assessment of the Severity of Diarrhoea
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

secondary_outcome.measure: Irritable Bowel Syndrome: Assessment of the Severity of Constipation
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Pantoprazole at Final Visit: Efficacy Regarding Irritable Bowel Syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=excellent, 2=good, 3=satisfactory, 4=not satisfactory

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Tolerability of Pantoprazole at Final Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=excellent, 2=good, 3=satisfactory, 4=not satisfactory

intervention.description: This was an observational study. Therefore, the physician decided about dosage according to individual needs (20 or 40 mg pantoprazole).

criteria.textblock:
Main inclusion criteria:
- Outpatients with gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD)
Main exclusion criteria:
- Criteria as defined in the Summary of Product Characteristics

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All patients were evaluated, missing values were not imputed.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: The measured value is related to the number of 4125 subjects (= valid cases). This number differs from the overall number of baseline participants due to missing data for 63 subjects.

outcome.title: Reflux-associated Gastrointestinal Symptoms: Assessment of the Severity of Heartburn
outcome.description: Physician's assessment on a scale with 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe
outcome.population: Patients included and treated with valid data at first and last visit (without imputation of missing values), intention to treat

group.title: Pantoprazole

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
